column3: So this was an easy win, even if the phantom zone build is a little wacky.&nbsp

column2: I am a little biased because I am so stoked for The Lego Batman movie and I get super giddy every time something new comes out for it, which seems like constantly.&nbsp
column3: It is such a strange build.&nbsp
column5: If you are not familar with the phantom zone, it is basically like this other dimension thing from the superman comics and movies where really bad guys are sent to rot for all eternity.&nbsp
column6: Since the movie has not been released as I write this, I am sooooo curious to see if it will play a part in the movie and what exactly the build is.&nbsp
column7: It has to be for something right?&nbsp
column8: It comes with good pieces and has a clear stand for it.&nbsp
column9: It looks great as a little display piece next to my other Batman sets.

column2: Good thing- it is one of the cheapest ways to get Batman.&nbsp
column3: Bad news- Batman comes in soooo many of the new sets we already have like 5 of him.&nbsp
column4: It would have been cool to maybe get a different version of him or bruce wayne or something.&nbsp
column5: But I am not too bothered by having another Batman.

column1: Overall, it is nothing to write home about.

,TRUE,5,4,5,3,4 Odeinoichus","2018-03-21T16:00:04.13Z","A decent offering, but LEGO has done better.","
column8: >Set #30522 Batman in the Phantom Zone:
column14: s odd for me to say this, but Polybags are often pretty ok, in fact there are very few Polybags which remain uninteresting in my eyes. Honestly though, this set is a bit of an odd duck, Batman in the Phantom Zone never encountered a creature like the one included with this set. More aptly I feel this would be better referred to as Batman in the Fortress of Solitude, because the model in this set features one of Superman&rsquo
column15: s security drones as seen in that scene of the film.

column8: >Ahem, now that that is out of the way, let&rsquo
column9: s discuss the pros and cons of this Polybag.

column16: >Model fits in quite well with the original LEGO Movie sets, the model could be likened to one of the Micro-Managers.
>A lot of nice pieces to be found here in dark maroon and trans-clear blue elements.
>Model has no interactive play features when facing Batman.

column8: >This particular set is for fans of The LEGO Batman movie who want every set, I would say the better Polybags from the theme are the miniature vehicles which were given out. Even the smaller Joker Polybag is slightly better than this one. So I&rsquo
column9: d mildly recommend it for completionists or anybody looking for a cheap Batman.

,TRUE,3,4,3,2,2 Red_Five2","2017-02-13T08:30:39.59Z","The Phantom zone???","

I had no idea what the phantom zone was until the movie. This is my first Lego Batman movie set. On February 11th you could pick it up with the times (in the UK).

column2: This is my first Batman. It comes with the new utility belt which is a separate mold. It comes with two expressions. One is smirking and the other is angry. The torso is pretty much the same to the 2012 version of Batman. His accessory is a baterang.

column3: t know what the build is but I know it is part of the Phantom zone. It comes on a transparent base. It has three transparent red tile studs. Also four blue rods, four arrows and four claw hands.

column1: Comes in a polybag with normal polybag size instructions.
You get some really cool pieces in this set. You get
column2: four trans blue sticks, four silver spikes, a clear pole, clear medium dish, and two trans blue dishes. The maroon parts are also really nice to get. The total piece count for the set is 59. Overall a really good piece haul.&nbsp

column1: You get Batman in this polybag. He has a double-sided head. On one side he has white eyes and a smile and on the other side he is angry and his eyes are close. He has his classic Batman mask and black soft cape. He has printing on the front and back of his torso of the suit, abs, and bat logo. He has a yellow belt which is really cool and adds a lot to the figure. He has plain black legs. He is armed with a black batarang. Overall a good figure.
The build was quick and easy. It took me a few minutes to build.

Overall this is a really good polybag. The drone look really cool with all the different pieces sticking out in a bunch of different directions. The clear pole and medium dish are used as a stand that provides great stability. Batman is great with the printing on his torso is great. The yellow utility belt adds some color and detail to him. I recommend this set if you are a Lego Batman fan or to your Lego Collection. Overall I'
The parts are ok, but building experience/price/playability is meh.
